SEARCH

Class ObjectHandler

java.lang.Object
ObjectHandler
public class ObjectHandler extends Object
Manages all game objects in the game world.

The ObjectHandler is responsible for adding, removing, updating, and rendering game objects. It also tracks the player object and manages level completion status.

  • Method Details

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Updates all game objects.

      Iterates through the list of game objects and calls their tick method. Uses an iterator to prevent ConcurrentModificationException.

    • render

      public void render(Graphics g)
      Renders all game objects.

      Iterates through the list of game objects and calls their render method.

      Parameters:
      g - the graphics context used for rendering

    • addObj

      public void addObj(GameObject obj)
      Adds a game object to the list.
      Parameters:
      obj - the game object to add

    • removeObj

      public void removeObj(GameObject obj)
      Removes a game object from the list.
      Parameters:
      obj - the game object to remove

    • getObjects

      public List<GameObject> getObjects()
      Retrieves the list of all game objects.
      Returns:
      the list of game objects

    • setPlayer

      public int setPlayer(Player player)
      Sets the player object.

      Adds the player to the list of game objects if it has not already been set.

      Parameters:
      player - the player object
      Returns:
      0 if the player was successfully added; -1 if a player already exists

    • removePlayer

      public int removePlayer()
      Removes the player object.
      Returns:
      0 if the player was successfully removed; -1 if no player exists

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Sets the player object.

      Adds the player to the list of game objects if it has not already been set.

      Parameters:
      player - the player object
      Returns:
      0 if the player was successfully added; -1 if a player already exists

    • removeObjects

      public void removeObjects()
      Removes the player object.

    • setEndLevel

      public void setEndLevel(boolean end)
      Sets the level completion status.
      Parameters:
      end - true if the level is completed; false otherwise

    • getEndLevel

      public boolean getEndLevel()
      Retrieves the level completion status.
      Returns:
      true if the level is completed; false otherwise
